parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

datasetStructure: One record per test per observation time or evaluation interval per subject

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all application or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: CVSEQ

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject and can be used to support relationships within the domain and between domains using RELREC. This is not the treatment group number.
datasetVariables.label: Group Identifier
datasetVariables.name: CVGRPID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference identifier
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: CVSPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120532

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). CVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: DIABP, HR, MAP, SYSBP.
datasetVariables.label: Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: CVTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120533

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVTEST

datasetVariables.description: Long name for CVTESTCD. The value in CVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Diastolic Blood Pressure, Heart Rate, Mean Arterial Pressure, Systolic Blood Pressure.
datasetVariables.label: Test Name
datasetVariables.name: CVTEST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVPOS

datasetVariables.description: Position of the subject during the measurement or examination. If the subject is restrained, populate with the position (example SITTING or STANDING); otherwise, populate with UNCONSTRAINED.
datasetVariables.label: Position of Subject During Test
datasetVariables.name: CVPOS

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVORRES

datasetVariables.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Findings as Collected
datasetVariables.name: CVORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVORRESU

datasetVariables.description: The unit for the original result. The unit of the original result should be mapped to a synonymous unit on the Controlled Terminology (http://www.cdisc.org/terminology) list.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Original Result
datasetVariables.name: CVORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from CVORRES in a standard format or standard units. CVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in CVSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Character Format
datasetVariables.name: CVSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; contains the numeric form of CVSTRESC. CVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Numeric Format
datasetVariables.name: CVSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for CVSTRESC and CVSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Standardized Result
datasetVariables.name: CVSTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVSTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate when a test is not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in CVORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: CVSTAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why CVSTAT is NOT DONE, such as BROKEN EQUIPMENT.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: CVREASND

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: Intravascular, External Cuff.
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test
datasetVariables.name: CVMETHOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90018

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVCSTATE

datasetVariables.description: Consciousness state of the subject at the time of measurement. Examples: CONSCIOUS, SEMI-CONSCIOUS, UNCONSCIOUS.
datasetVariables.label: Consciousness State
datasetVariables.name: CVCSTATE

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVBLFL

datasetVariables.description: A baseline indicator may be used to calculate differences or changes from baseline. Value should be Y or null. The baseline flag is sponsor defined.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: CVBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: CVDRVFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVEXCLFL

datasetVariables.description: Y if the result should be excluded from all calculations, otherwise null.
datasetVariables.label: Exclusion Flag
datasetVariables.name: CVEXCLFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVREASEX

datasetVariables.description: The reason the result should be excluded from all calculations. Used only when CVEXCLFL is Y.
datasetVariables.label: Reason for Exclusion
datasetVariables.name: CVREASEX

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVUSCHFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicates whether the timing of the performed test or observation was unscheduled. If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
datasetVariables.name: CVUSCHFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of cardiovascular data collection, in ISO 8601 format. For measurements related to a continuous evaluation interval, CVDTC should be used to indicate the start date/time of that interval.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Cardiovascular Test
datasetVariables.name: CVDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of end of a cardiovascular evaluation interval, in ISO 8601 format. Should be populated when CVDTC represents the start date/time of a continuous evaluation interval.
datasetVariables.label: End Date/Time of Cardiovascular Test
datasetVariables.name: CVENDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of cardiovascular data collection, in integer days. For measurements related to a continuous evaluation interval, CVDY can be used to indicate start day of that interval. The algorithm for calculating the day must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Cardiovascular Test
datasetVariables.name: CVDY

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of End of Observation

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVENDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Cardiovascular Test

datasetVariables.description: Study day of the end of a cardiovascular evaluation interval, in integer days. Can be populated when CVDY represents the start day of a continuous evaluation interval. The algorithm for calculating the day must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of End of Cardiovascular Test
datasetVariables.name: CVENDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVNOMDY

datasetVariables.description: Nominal study day used for grouping records for observations that may occur on different days into a single reported study day. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
datasetVariables.name: CVNOMDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVNOMLBL

datasetVariables.description: A label for a given value of CVNOMDY as presented in the study report Examples: Pretreatment, Week 4, Day 28.
datasetVariables.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
datasetVariables.name: CVNOMLBL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVTPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when data should be collected. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See CVTPTNUM and CVTPTREF. Examples: Predose, 1 Hour Postdose.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: CVTPT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of CVTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: CVTPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601 format) relative to a fixed time point reference (CVTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by CVTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by CVTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: CVELTM

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by CVELTM, if used for CVTPTNUM, and CVTPT. It is recommended that CVTPTREF be as descriptive as possible so the reference time point can be inferred without looking at others variables. Example: DAY 1 FIRST DOSE.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: CVTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the reference time point, CVTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: CVRFTDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVEVLINT

datasetVariables.description: Length of evaluation interval in ISO 8601 duration format. Used in place of CVSTINT and CVENINT when CVTPTREF is not available.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluation Interval
datasetVariables.name: CVEVLINT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVSTINT

datasetVariables.description: Planned start of an assessment interval relative to Time Point Reference (CVTPTREF) in ISO 8601 duration format. Example: When the evaluation interval is from 1 to 2 hours after dosing, the value would be PT1H.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
datasetVariables.name: CVSTINT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable CV.CVENINT

datasetVariables.description: Planned end of an assessment interval relative to Time Point Reference (CVTPTREF) in ISO 8601 duration format. Example: When the evaluation interval is from 1 to 2 hours after dosing, the value would be PT2H.
datasetVariables.label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
datasetVariables.name: CVENINT

description: A findings domain that contains physiological and morphological findings related to the cardiovascular system, including the heart, blood vessels and lymphatic vessels. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, SDOMAIN, C102605, 2018-06-29)
label: Cardiovascular Findings
name: CV
